revised_title: Diophantine Approximation in Fuchsian Groups: Geometry and Measure-Theoretic Structure
tldr: This article explores the geometric and measure-theoretic structure of the limit set of a Fuchsian group, focusing on diophantine approximation. The author provides a complete solution to the problem of how well the images of a distinguished point approximate an arbitrary limit point, and extends the analogy with the metrical theory of numbers to Fuchsian groups.
